title: Turki Al-Khudhayr
text:
Turki Mohammed Al-Khudayr (; born in 1980) is a Saudi Arabian <a href="soccer">football</a> referee. He has refereed in the <a href="Saudi%20Professional%20League">Saudi Professional League</a> since 2009 and has been a full international referee for FIFA since 2014. He refereed at the <a href="2019%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2019 AFC Asian Cup</a> and also refereed the <a href="2015%20Saudi%20Crown%20Prince%20Cup%20Final">2015 Saudi Crown Prince Cup Final</a>.
Career.
On 17 March 2015, he was summoned at the <a href="2018%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">2018 FIFA World Cup qualification</a> match in <a href="Russia">Russia</a> during the match between <a href="Brunei%20national%20football%20team">Brunei</a> and <a href="Chinese%20Taipei%20national%20football%20team">Chinese Taipei</a>.
On 16 December 2019, after the match between <a href="Indian%20Super%20League">Indian Super League</a> clubs <a href="Bengaluru">Bengaluru</a> and <a href="Mumbai%20City%20FC">Mumbai City FC</a> (which Mumbai City FC won 3–2 against Bengaluru), Mumbai City FC coach, <a href="Jorge%20Costa">Jorge Costa</a> of Portugal, has launched an allegation against Al-Khudayr for calling a Mumbai City FC player <a href="S%C3%A8rge%20Kevyn">Sèrge Kevyn</a>, of Gabon, with racist slurs as a “monkey” in Al-Khudayr's perspective of Anguoue making “disrespectful gestures”. On 17 December 2019, the allegations were reported to the <a href="All%20India%20Football%20Federation">All India Football Federation</a>, and an the investigation will be launched by the federation against Al-Khudayr. "The AIFF follows a zero toleration policy against racism and the complaint has been forwarded to the Disciplinary Committee to investigate into the matter and take appropriate action if found guilty," the AIFF stated.
